page.title: 19WRITTLE,OUTLYING HAMLETS
page.content: Oxney Green is one of the small hamlets on the outskirts of Writtle. In the original Domesday Book it is described as an enclosure for oxen. According to the 1924 Ordnance Survey map it was above Chequers Rd. and Eastview. It included Bulmer's Farm up to the parish boundary. There was a water tower at Oxney Green which supplied the inhabitants with water. This was situated in Tower Rd. and has since been pulled down. Oxney Green used to have its own services and amenities but now it tends to rely on Writtle for these services. In fact this has happened to most of the hamlets surrounding Writtle.
